settings.helpText: The type of the object
Stackbit model type
The title of the page
The excerpt of the page displayed in meta data
Page sections
The URL path of this page relative to site root. For example, the site root page would be "/", and post page would be "posts/new-post/"
Stackbit model type
The file path of the file that stores this data
Stackbit model type
The copyright text displayed in the footer
List of links in the footer
Display social links in the footer
List of social links in the footer
The type of the object
Stackbit model type
The title displayed in the header
Display the navigation bar in the header
List of navigation links
The type of the object
Stackbit model type
Site title
The default site description used in meta data
The file path of the configuration file
Stackbit model type
The title of the page
The text displayed just below the title
The excerpt of the page displayed in meta data
The URL path of this page relative to site root. For example, the site root page would be "/", and post page would be "posts/new-post/"
Page content
Stackbit model type
The title of the post
The text displayed just below the title
The image displayed in the single post
The image displayed in any thumbnails for the post
The excerpt of the post displayed in the blog feed and in meta data
The URL path of this page relative to site root. For example, the site root page would be "/", and post page would be "posts/new-post/"
Page content
Stackbit model type
The section title (Used by the CMS, even if it is not displayed in the section)
A unique identifier that can be used when linking to this section. Must not contain whitespace.
The image of the section
The text content of the section
The type of the object
Stackbit model type
The section title (Used by the CMS, even if it is not displayed in the section)
A unique identifier that can be used when linking to this section. Must not contain whitespace.
The subtitle of the header section
The image to display with the text
The type of the object
Stackbit model type
The section title (Used by the CMS, even if it is not displayed in the section)
A unique identifier that can be used when linking to this section. Must not contain whitespace.

### Inline Code and Code Blocks

Blocks of code are either fenced by lines with `three back-ticks`, or are indented `with four spaces`.

```
<!-- Some example CSS code -->
h1 {
    font-size: 2.5rem;
}
```

Inline `code` has `back-ticks around` it.
